poem:
"Encampment Verses"

A tent is but a symbol,
points to hatred, pus and throb -
Of antisemitism's rise,
The Muslim's fearful sob.

A warning spelled in canvas folds,
Universities, beware - 
The nuggets of democracy
are not immune to scare.

The mundane act of staking ground
screams loud its mortal stakes,
An echo of the disregarded love,
and the unity it breaks.
